Is it true that in any finite colouring of the integers there exists a monochromatic solution to\[\frac{1}{a}=\frac{1}{b}+\frac{1}{c}\]with distinct $a,b,c$?



The density version of this is [302]. This colouring version is true, as proved by Brown and R\"{o}dl \cite{BrRo91}.

This problem has been formalised in Lean as part of the Google DeepMind Formal Conjectures project.




References


[BrRo91] Brown, Tom C. and R\"{o}dl, Voijtech, Monochromatic solutions to equations with unit fractions. Bull. Austral. Math. Soc. (1991), 387-392.
